lexUnit.name: garden.n

document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: FN: a small plot of land used for growing vegetables and/or flowers.

sentence.text: In a city of such human proportions it is not surprising that parks and gardens abound for recreation and relaxation .
Phoenix Park in the northwest is the largest open space , but squares like St . Stephen 's Green are the garden oases of the city .

The beautiful Wicklow Mountains , and the Wicklow Mountains National Park provide a more rugged countryside , and the area has breathtaking houses and gardens such as Castletown , Mount Usher , and Powerscourt .

These are particularly exciting times at the Indianapolis Museum of Art : Progress continues on the J.K. Lilly estate-Oldfields , our Ravine Garden has been restored to its original splendor , and there is national attention showered on our current exhibition of Japanese Painting. ( please see The New York Times article I have included. ) With thousands of trees and flowers in bloom , we are having a beautiful Spring !
The park 's 10.5 hectares ( 25 acres ) of landscaped gardens and lakes contains a large greenhouse that holds many species of plants , and an aviary of exotic birds .
If you 're up to a climb , take the Mount Austin road to the Victoria Peak Gardens .
These gardens used to belong to the governor 's mountain lodge , but the building was demolished by the Japanese during the occupation of Hong Kong .
Across from the mansion , the Zoological and Botanical Gardens ( gardens open daily 6 am - 10 pm ; zoo 6 am - 7 pm ; admission free ) provide a welcome oasis amid the big - city pressures .

A few blocks up Nathan Road is Kowloon Park ( open daily 6 am - midnight ) , elegantly laid out with fountains , promenades , and ornamental gardens ; be sure to go up the steps to see the Sculpture Walk .
Near Boundary Street , off Prince Edward Street West , is the Yuen Po Street Bird Garden ( open 8 am - 7 pm ) .
This `` Temple of Green Pines `` is a spacious complex containing temples and pavilions , statues , and gardens .
The preservation of this wonderful home is ongoing ; a projected restoration of the original garden is still in progress .
The park is landscaped with lakes and gardens .
An unexpected piece of historical memorabilia turns up in the monastery garden , where guides point out a small stone table used for a treaty - signing ceremony in 1844 .
For a different vision of Old China , spend a few quiet moments in the classic Lou Lim Ieoc Garden .
Local legend claims that he wrote part of his great saga , Os Lusiadas , in what is now called the Camoes Grotto , situated in the spacious tropical Camoes Garden .
Governess and children hardly go out at all , except into the garden .
